alert.note: Alert for York (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 09 at 6:12PM EST until further notice by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT EST TONIGHT... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of York County in Upstate South Carolina. * WHEN...Until midnight EST tonight. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 608 PM EST, Automated rain gagues reported 2 to 4 inches of rain in the past 18 hours across much of York County. Runoff from this recent heavy rainfall is producing minor flooding in the advisory area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Rock Hill, York, Newport, Lesslie, Sharon and Mcconnells. - Flooding is most likely along Fishing Creek, Tools Fork Creek, and Wildcat Creek. This will likely lead to water flowing over the bridge on Ogden Road. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: When it is safe to do so, please report flooding threatening roads or property to the National Weather Service Greenville-Spartanburg by calling toll free, 1, 800, 2 6 7, 8 1 0 1, by posting on our Facebook page, or via Twitter using hashtag NWSGSP. Your message should describe the specific location where impacts occurred and the depth of flooding observed. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
